caption: Nice place, good service and excellent drinks.
Ok
delicious juice, inviting airy interior, very polite and bubbly staff!

A nice selection of gluten free dishes and juices. Most of the juices are strictly fruits or vegetables and may not be sweet enough for some people. They are taking excellent precautions during Covid-19 to prepare and minimize there amount of people within the store at once.

An apt name for a very airy chill coffee spot with great xi. The staff in back and our front are attentive and warm. Also, love the decor and merchandise for sale. The standard drip was fresh, delicious, and 'to stay' served in a mug so large you have to hold it with both hands like a lady in the "after" part of an antidepressant commercial. Looking forward to coming back!
Very small and little seating

I tried ordering a simple Açaí bowl on Uber eats. I called the restaurant before placing my order to ensure what I wanted. After waiting 30 mins and getting the notification that my order was about to be picked up, I get a call from the restaurant stating they have no Açaí. This was plain laziness. It’s a small spot and they were attempting to make the bowl when the driver arrived. I lost my $30 promotional credit because of this. I asked the restaurant to cancel it on their end however they did not & my order still said that it was delivered. I’m never using Uber eats or getting anything from Lively again.

Most expensive smoothie I've ever purchased but also very delicious so I suppose it balances out, usually really empty, very chill, child friendly AND all fresh!!! you can even see them labeling fresh made products sometimes which is cool.

The aesthetic of the shoppe and the pleasing-to-the-eye design of the bottles, labels and snacks had me fooled. The menu looked so unique and right up my alley! I'm a total jus-head and have tried all the major jus shoppes in NYC. I've always longed for a spot that makes mylks and juices identified by color (ex: blue mylk, pink mylk. Etc.). Lively also does what most others don't, they add synergistic adaptogens and other spices and herbs like tocos and maca to their signature drinks.  Unfortunately, although I REALLY wanted to be a fan, their products are pretty gnarly and rancid. They simply don't taste fresh. I'm so disappointed. It's one of those experiences where you keep drinking hoping you'll get used to it and develop a taste for it... Nope. Godawful. Serious props to the design and the unique menu. It's a shame, don't waste your money.

Can’t say enough good things about Lively: first and foremost, the kind and lovely staff; then, the great coffees and especially the tea selection; also, the lovely chill vibe. And good WiFi too! I love this neighborhood gem.
really good .....the food is
Enjoying breakfast like this...home delivery at its best. Hazelnut chocolate toast (pic) & coconut toast was delivered the same way.
Great chill spot that has juice, smoothies, coffee, and a few bites. Gluten free friendly! WiFi available. Clean and light feel with plants.

I'm a regular customer here, have spent hundreds, very loyal but I must say I feel frustrated. The first warm weather day I'm here and the juice I got smells and tastes RANCID. They refused to exchange or return or even apologize. Very upset and disappointed considering the price.
The coconut toast was amazing (other options look delicious as well), and the barista was really patient in helping me choose (super friendly too)! The space was adorable as well :)
love this place...
This is my neighborhood spot. The baristas are completely lovely and the food is delicious and fits all my allergy concerns!
Wish I could stay here for the entire day and eat 100 peanut butter cookies while drinking cortado. Yummy!
Great staff
I absolutely love everything about this place. Coffee and juices are amazing and so is the service!  They also serve my favourite tea ❤️.
if i could repeat my life over, i would do everything the same, except i would not go here.
Not only is the coffee super bitter and acidic, but the staff was cold and unfriendly :/ not the best experience. Would not recommend.
Just terrible. Don't waste your time.
Great food, amazing people who work there... what’s not to like? Stop in and support them.
Great pre made juices.

The barista is the nicest guy ever. Food is totally fresh and unique.The decor, vibe and health-food menu are super L.A. trendy. There’s WiFi, but it’s not really a place for laptop peeps. No outlets. There’s no bathroom - not cool when you sell drinks!

Great healthy and delivery accurate.  Couldn't be nicer!   I have ordered a dozen or so times and the coconut toast and their soups are great.  the Juices come in a glass bottle, not a plastic cup, and are REALLY on point but not as expensive as other spots.  A+ .

I finally decided to go to Lively Brooklyn last weekend for a breakfast! And I was extremely satisfied. This cafe is like the cutest and coziest with the prettiest decoration . I cannot get over the interior haha! Small cafe but with great decoration , plants and lighting. We ordered the almond butter toast , avocado toast and cortado and another coffee with ghee( forgot the name sorry) . The breakfast had been one of the best breakfast we had. The food was delicious! We had the perfect Instagram worthy seating lol and food looked as pretty as it tasted. I love how they have really good magazines/ books to read. I will say the employee was really sweet and friendly. Me and my boyfriend had an amazing breakfast date here! I really recommend you all this cute cafe if you're looking for a great food and an aesthetic vibe!
Premade salads so good

Horrendoes service. Had a terrible experience with one of  their barista’s who was obnoxiously rude to me. I have been coming here for coffee and occasional snack for over 4 months on almost daily basis , I suppose that qualifies me as a regular customer . It was pleasant at first , and one of their barista is actually a very polite and sweet guy . The issue was with someone else , as she yelled and slammed coffee at me one morning, Oh and threatened to call police!! I was more than outraged at what happened but particularly how the sitauation was handled. The manager never addressed this incident , the barista still works there. So I suppose by their standards this is an acceptable behavior by their staff. Major disappointment ,  with abundance of places in the area I will be taking my business elsewhere. Good luck to you , with service like that , I don’t think you’ll survive much longer.

I wanna love this place because it’s so cute, light, and airy.  In other words, it’s one of those super cute instagrammable places, especially that little corner spot, and the staff is friendly, and they allow dogs in! But let’s talk coffee: I’ve had their coffee, from cortado, to ice coffee and regular brew and they have all tasted toooo acidic.  I only drink black coffee so I can really taste the intense sour acidity.  A bit disappointing, especially for the price they charge.  Their fresh juices however is their saving grace.  Now I go mainly just for those, and pick up coffee elsewhere.

Lively is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood!  They have an amazing staff who are always friendly.  I love the pressed juices, the almond toast is so yummy, and their grab and go salads are great too.  Happy to have them in South Slope!

The worst. I came in today after reading great reviews online. Passed by today and actually had my husband pull over just so I could go in . The aesthetic is beautiful and the young lady at the counter was phenomenal but that is where it ends . My smoothie was obviously made incorrectly. I told the cashier whose demeanor seemed to change instantly . She said the smoothie would have to be made over . Which I was fine with . I told her I would definitely wait and took a seat. After that she returned to tell me that the chef refused to make the smoothie for me. I was actually blown away. I had to laugh. I explained that I know spirulina and matcha can often overcome other flavors but that I am 100 percent certain there was no banana in my smoothie ., which it was supposed to have . Apparently they use frozen bananas and that’s why my smoothie tasted like frozen water and nothing else :/ I left with some sugar in a cup which I was told to add to the smoothie mysel and $9.50 later , quite disappointed I left the store . I say all of this to say. I work in a service industry and I know what negative reviews can do to a small business so I never post them but I was incredibly disappointed by the service I received today . I was kind , super understanding and I think it would have behooved the staff to make a better effort. It’s really not that hard to treat every customer the way you would want to be treated .

Fancy upscale juicy drinks under $10 and salads. Ready-made with ingredients the best of the best, spirulina, matcha, tocopherols, coconut milk, coconut butter, coconut crystals, bananas, blueberries, chia pudding, acai bowl, almond milk with mixes yummy things in it including some kind of "blue magic".

Very contemporary interior - if pinterest and the williamsburg plant store i get succelents at had a baby itd be this store. I dont like juice but they got a lot, and have coffee. Chic and trendy, good for you fools thirsty for them IG hearts. 4/5, would go again fo sho

Their healthy chocolate smoothie and coconut toast are to die for! Do not miss this Park Slope gem. The young man behind the counter in the mornings is incredibly kind, helpful, and knowledgeable about all their juices!
Vegan options galore! Cold pressed juices are $10 bucks, but it’s worth every penny. Served in a glass bottle—return it for $1 off your next juice purchase.
Everything I've tried has been great. Beautiful, clean space. Friendly service. They are expensive but not worse than the other trendy shops in the neighborhood.
Amazing space and delicious food.

Over priced food, Oatmeal lacks deliciousness, espresso is pricey. Justification for priceiness is that they claim everything is Gluten free and organic, also they claim that another local nearby cafe is more expensive.
